src:
Perbandingan Biaya Transfer OVO Cs dengan Bank, Pilih Mana?
02 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Foto: Ardan Adhi Chandra

Jakarta - Layanan dompet elektronik OVO mengumumkan akan mengenakan biaya untuk transfer ke bank lain. Kebijakan itu berlaku mulai 12 Desember 2019, dan biaya yang dikenakan sebesar Rp 2.500 per transaksi. Saat ini OVO masih memberikan promosi untuk 10 pengiriman uang ke bank bebas biaya transfer. Namun yang perlu diperhatikan, setelah melakukan 10 kali transfer bebas biaya, nasabah dikenakan biaya transfer Rp 3.000 per transaksi. Selain OVO, juga ada layanan fintech milik PT Bank Tabungan Pensiunan Nasional Tbk (BTPN) yakni Jenius yang sebelumnya memberikan fasilitas gratis biaya transaksi. Namun ada syarat yang harus dipenuhi yakni 25 kali gratis transfer antar bank lewat Jenius selama dua bulan pertama untuk nasabah yang baru teregistrasi dan aktivasi Jenius. Kemudian, Jenius juga memberikan 25 kali transaksi pertama setiap bulan dengan saldo rata-rata minimum Rp 10 juta. Selanjutnya 15 kali transaksi pertama setiap bulan dengan minimal saldo rata-rata bulan sebelumnya Rp 1 juta - Rp 9,99 juta. Jika transaksi berikutnya melebihi kuota gratis maka biaya yang dikenakan adalah Rp 3.000 per transaksi.Lalu aplikasi digibank, milik bank DBS yang sebelumnya memberikan fasilitas gratis transfer ke bank lain tanpa minimum saldo mengendap. Saat ini untuk transfer dana ke bank lain baru bisa mendapatkan fasilitas gratis biaya jika saldonya lebih dari Rp 1 juta. Dengan perhitungan saldo rata-rata harian dari semua produk seperti tabungan, deposito dan e-SBN bulan sebelumnya. Jika di bawah Rp 1 juta maka biaya transfer online sebesar Rp 3.000, dengan kliring Rp 3.000 dan biaya real time gross setllement (RTGS) Rp 20.000. Selanjutnya ada DANA yang hingga saat ini masih memberikan bebas biaya transfer antar DANA hingga antar Bank. Saat ini pengiriman uang antar bank menggunakan jaringan yang sama tak dikenakan biaya. Sedangkan jika menggunakan jaringan ATM bersama sebesar Rp 6.500, jaringan PRIMA Rp 7.500 dan jaringan Ciruss Rp 25.000. Ada pula jaringan ATM milik BUMN yakni Link yang memungkinkan transfer antar bank BUMN menjadi lebih murah yakni Rp 4.000 per transaksi.Jadi detikers, mau pilih mana? Kirim uang pakai aplikasi atau lewat bank?Simak Video "Rudiantara Semringah Sambut OVO Jadi Unicorn Kelima Indonesia"[Gambas:Video 20detik](kil/hns)
text:
Comparison of OVO Cs and Bank Transfer Fees, Choose Which?
02 Nov 2019, 13:00 by Sylke Febrina Laucereno


Photo: Ardan Adhi Chandra

Jakarta - OVO electronic wallet service announced it will charge fees for transfers to other banks. The policy takes effect from December 12, 2019, and the fee is Rp 2,500 per transaction. At present OVO is still providing promotions for 10 money transfers to banks free of transfer fees. But to note, after making 10 free transfers, customers are charged a transfer fee of Rp 3,000 per transaction. In addition to OVO, there is also a fintech service owned by PT Bank Tabungan Pensiunan Nasional Tbk (BTPN) namely Jenius who previously provided a free transaction fee facility. However, there are requirements that must be fulfilled, namely 25 free bank transfers via Jenius during the first two months for newly registered customers and Jenius activation. Then, Jenius also gives the first 25 transactions each month with an average minimum balance of Rp. 10 million. Furthermore, the first 15 transactions each month with a minimum average balance of the previous month of Rp 1 million - Rp 9.99 million. If the next transaction exceeds the free quota, the fee charged is IDR 3,000 per transaction. Then the application is owned by DBS bank, which previously provided free transfer facilities to other banks without the minimum deposit settling. At the moment to transfer funds to other banks, you can only get free facilities if the balance is more than Rp. 1 million. With the calculation of the average daily balance of all products such as savings, deposits and e-SBN the previous month. If under Rp. 1 million, the online transfer fee is Rp. 3,000, with a clearing of Rp. 3,000 and a real time gross settlement (RTGS) fee of Rp. 20,000. Furthermore, there are FUNDS which until now still provide free transfer fees between FUNDS and between banks. At present interbank money transfers using the same network are free. Whereas if you use a shared ATM network of IDR 6,500, PRIMA network of IDR 7,500 and Ciruss network of IDR 25,000. There is also a state-owned ATM network, Link that allows transfers between state-owned banks to be cheaper at Rp 4,000 per transaction. So, who do you want to choose? Send money using the application or through the bank? See Video "Rudiantara Semringah Welcomes OVO Becomes Fifth Unicorn of Indonesia" [Gambas: Video 20 seconds] (kil / hns)
